title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
09:33 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <vmassol> hello xwikibot  
09:40 <+sburjan`> good morning vmassol.  
09:40 <+sburjan`> and everyone  
09:44 <vmassol> sburjan`: gm, hope you had some good short holidays  
09:45 <+sburjan`> yes, the holidays were short but good. I am working today to help testing 3.5.1 and 4.0. I will focus mostly on database migration  
09:45 <vmassol> sburjan`: I talked to Silvia yesterday, you may want to have a quick status check with her  
09:45 <+sburjan`> Silvia told me that postgres works on 3.5.1, but I wasn't able to properly migrate. She told me that I was skipping a step, I wil ltry again to reproduce  
09:45 <+sburjan`> I already had  
09:45 <vmassol> sburjan`: you already discussed this with sdumitriu AFAIK  
09:46 <vmassol> AFAIR you were simply using the wrong mapping file  
09:46 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu committed a fix exactly last friday. I tested with that, but I was still unable to make it work.  
09:47 <vmassol> ah ok, unfortunately I tried to get info from sdumitriu but he's not answering much :(  
09:47 <+sburjan`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e8a4d64dab1f2dfbce9fe70e24c0ca9166956f53 didn't do the trick, if this is what you're talking about  
09:47 <vmassol> yep  
09:47 <+sburjan`> but I wil lre-test today to make sure  
09:47 <vmassol> that's what I was talking about  
09:48 <vmassol> ok we need to release 3.5.1 ASAP we're already very very late  
09:48 <vmassol> and it's become very urgent now  
09:48 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <+sburjan`> yes, I know. I am aware of it, this is why I tested 3.5 last friday. and I've had issues only with postgres  
09:49 <+sburjan`> going to re-test all databases for 3.5.1  
09:52 <vmassol> ok  
10:09 <abusenius\_> has quit  
10:09 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <blackbird\_> has quit  
10:59 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r7a490bb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/7a490bbb5824a1a0207e1085e81a43454b6e834b / (7 files in 7 dirs): XCOMMONS-150: Move ComponentManager deprecated methods to Legacy modules ...  
11:06 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r887e9bc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/887e9bcf324606282e88e15df454331acc302159 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-component/xwiki-platform-component-multi/src/main/java/org/xwiki/component/internal/ContextComponentManager.java : XCOMMONS-150: Move ComponentManager deprecated methods to Legacy modules ...  
11:11 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <jvelo> Hi, evalica, all what do you think of https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/44 ?  
11:13 <jvelo> ( XWIKI-7720  )  
11:13 <vmassol> jvelo: hi  
11:13 <vmassol> do you know if it's normal that we return only a single result in the JSON for a livetable even when there are multiple objects in a given doc for the class we're looking for?  
11:14 <vmassol> why not return them all?  
11:14 <jvelo> I think it was by design  
11:14 <vmassol> do you know cases when we wouldn't want this? IMO this should be the default behavior  
11:14 <vmassol> and possiblty a flag to return only one result if there's a use case  
11:14 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:15 <jvelo> yes that would be fine  
11:15 <vmassol> ok I'll dig a bit to see what it would mean to implement this  
11:16 <jvelo> it complexifies a bit and introduce the needs for programming right, but I guess that's OK  
11:16 <jvelo> (unless the logic is ported to a backend function that bypass thePR, of course)  
11:16 <vmassol> k  
11:19 <evalica> has quit  
11:25 <+sburjan`> where should I report a small improvement in the Wiki Editor ? which is the proper component in platform ?  
11:31 <vmassol> web module  
11:32 <jvelo> mflorea, hi  
11:33 <jvelo> just to let you know : the dynamic message tool of AWM doesn't work by default on a subwiki of XEM  
11:33 <+mflorea> Hi jvelo  
11:33 <jvelo> "You don't have the rights to execute this script" error  
11:33 <+mflorea> it needs PR  
11:34 <+mflorea> there are other pages that need PR too  
11:34 <+mflorea> the class editor for instance  
11:34 <jvelo> that's not an excuse ;)  
11:34 <+mflorea> sure, I'm just given an explanation :)  
11:35 <jvelo> anyway I don't understand why this dyn msg tool isn't done in java  
11:35 <vmassol> there are way too many stuff done in wiki pages for usre  
11:35 <+mflorea> because it was easier/quicker to do it in groovy/velocity  
11:35 <vmassol> I'm looking at the livetable macros and they're a major pain to be in velocity scripts to  
11:36 <vmassol> mflorea: easier/quicker on the short run but that means increasing the tech debt  
11:37 <+mflorea> sure, I'm aware of that, but when I wrote that code it had to be included in XE 3.3, so that was the only way, considering the available time  
11:37 <+mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7375  
11:37 <vmassol> as long as you're fixing it now it's ok ;)  
11:38 <vmassol> since 3.3 has been released a long time ago already  
11:38 <vmassol> :)  
11:38 <+mflorea> sure, but in the mean time I was release manager and now I work on something else  
11:38 <+mflorea> it's on the TODO list, but there were other thing more important  
11:38 <vmassol> (that's what I mean by tech debt, tech debt is always ok when it's managed (ie not out of control, it becomes an issue when it's unmanager)  
11:38 <vmassol> \*unmanaged  
11:39 <jvelo> mflorea, one thing you can do when you have several pages that need PR in an application is check for it and warn users  
11:39 <jvelo> check out for example the code of https://github.com/jvelo/xwiki-reader/blob/master/src/main/resources/ReaderCode/OPMLImportSheet.xml  
11:40 <jvelo> right now AWM fails quite in a ugly way in XEM  
11:40 <jvelo> it looks like it doesn't work  
11:40 <vmassol> when someone has to pay the tech debts of others, it's hard… which is what I'm seeing right now with the livetable code… yuck  
11:41 <+mflorea> jvelo: I'm not sure that all apps should do this. AWM pages that require PR have the RequiredRightClass objects attached and level set to programming, so you should know when you import the AWM in a sub wiki  
11:42 <+mflorea> i.e. this is a general problem, with any app that uses PR  
11:42 <+mflorea> e.g. with any XAR extension from e.x.o that needs PR, and you try to install it on a sub wiki  
11:45 <jvelo> mflorea, yes it's a general problem I agree  
11:45 <vmassol> jvelo: I should be able to simple replace calls to $xwiki.searchDocuments by calls to the query manager  
11:45 <jvelo> vmassol, anything has technical debt  
11:46 <jvelo> as soon as you touch code your paying some and creating some ;)  
11:46 <vmassol> jvelo: if you're saying that everything has the same value I don't agree  
11:46 <vmassol> so putting everything in the same bad doesn't make sense to me  
11:46 <+mflorea> jvelo: does it work in Workspaces? if the page is saved by a global user that has PR (and workspaces have only global users)  
11:46 <jvelo> no I'm not saying that  
11:46 <vmassol> s/bad/bag/  
11:46 <vmassol> some stuff are in a much worse condition than other  
11:47 <jvelo> sure  
11:47 <vmassol> and some people are refactoring their code while others aren't  
11:47 <vmassol> there's no magic  
11:47 <jvelo> but it's not so black/white  
11:47 <vmassol> as you say  
11:47 <jvelo> for example debt varies with who looks at it  
11:47 <vmassol> some people keep the mess and others take the time to fix it  
11:48 <vmassol> it doesn't make it easier for them  
11:48 <jvelo> sure, but what I mean is that the notion of "fixed" and of "mess" is relative  
11:48 <vmassol> what's hard is fixing someone else' mess  
11:48 <jvelo> it can be fixed for you and not for me  
11:48 <jvelo> etc.  
11:49 <vmassol> sure but we have a shared notion of common practices on this project  
11:49 <vmassol> so I'm pretty sure we agree at 80% at least  
11:49 <jvelo> it's more subtle than just the practices  
11:50 <jvelo> often by fixing something you alter the features  
11:50 <jvelo> it might be "fixed" in terms of technical elegance  
11:50 <jvelo> but it doesn't offer the same  
11:50 <jvelo> etc  
11:50 <jvelo> anyway I'm just playing the devil advocate as you'd say ;)  
11:51 <vmassol> right now I'm on livetable  
11:51 <vmassol> and I find it so much a mess than I'm hesitating throwinf everything away  
11:51 <+mflorea> what part of the live table?  
11:51 <jvelo> the velocity backend I guess  
11:51 <vmassol> right now I'm just looking at gridresult\_buildRowsJSON  
11:52 <+mflorea> and?  
11:52 <vmassol> it has nothing to do in velocity as a start  
11:52 <+mflorea> (btw, it was a huge velocity macro before a split in it smaller ones)  
11:52 <vmassol> anything done in wiki page is just wrong  
11:52 <vmassol> plain wrong  
11:52 <vmassol> you cannot debug it  
11:53 <+mflorea> you can enhance it  
11:53 <vmassol> you cannot have unit tests  
11:53 <vmassol> you don't have syntax coloring, nor autocpmpletion  
11:53 <vmassol> nor can you refactor it easily  
11:53 <vmassol> right now I need to change  
11:53 <vmassol> searchDocuments  
11:53 <vmassol> in favor of using xwql  
11:53 <jvelo> vmassol, good luck with that  
11:53 <jvelo> ;)  
11:53 <vmassol> and that's already hard  
11:53 <vmassol> I need to track down all calls by hand  
11:54 <vmassol> navigate to different pages  
11:54 <jvelo> you'll have to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7273 first  
11:54 <vmassol> etc  
11:54 <vmassol> hey http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7273 is the opposite as to why I wanted to use it ;)  
11:55 <jvelo> aha  
11:55 <jvelo> it's a feature for you  
11:55 <vmassol> yep I was considering it a feature....  
11:55 <vmassol> I really don't think we should add distinct  
11:55 <jvelo> but the problem with XWIKI-7273 is not the objects  
11:55 <vmassol> that should be a filter  
11:55 <jvelo> it's the languages  
11:56 <vmassol> it's useful to return several documents  
11:56 <jvelo> not that often  
11:56 <vmassol> it doesn' tmatter how often  
11:56 <vmassol> if there's only 1 use case it's enough  
11:56 <vmassol> and we now have query filters  
11:57 <jvelo> you'll make the 99% use the filter  
11:57 <jvelo> it should then be the other way around  
11:57 <jvelo> #occupyquery  
11:57 <vmassol> it's not us  
11:57 <vmassol> it's SQL  
11:57 <vmassol> by default it returns all  
11:57 <vmassol> not the opposite  
11:57 <vmassol> you have to add a filter to return only 1  
11:57 <jvelo> I'm thinking as a API consumer  
11:57 <vmassol> (distinct)  
11:58 <jvelo> with your strategy for any trivial query, you will need 2 filters  
11:58 <vmassol> my strategy  
11:58 <jvelo> query.addFilter("hidden").addFilter("distinct")  
11:58 <vmassol> is to be able to construct the query in the future  
11:58 <jvelo> because that's what you need most of the times  
11:58 <vmassol> yep  
11:58 <vmassol> exactly  
11:59 <vmassol> nothing prevents us from having a layer that does this by default for those who need it  
11:59 <jvelo> well filter should be able work the other way around too  
11:59 <vmassol> but hard coding a behavior is always bad  
11:59 <jvelo> who talked about hard coding ?  
11:59 <vmassol> distinct  
11:59 <vmassol> your patch hardcoded it AFAIU  
11:59 <jvelo> a filter could remove the distinct  
11:59 <jvelo> ah yes  
12:00 <jvelo> well I mimiked the default behavior in XWiki right now  
12:00 <vmassol> I m' really against this logic  
12:00 <vmassol> of putting stuff in and removing them  
12:00 <jvelo> now a filter is an improvement  
12:00 <vmassol> it's better to have a generic api  
12:00 <vmassol> and then have a more restricted api on top of it for specific use cases  
12:01 <jvelo> well the generic API exists already  
12:01 <jvelo> it's the query module  
12:01 <jvelo> but OK I see your point  
12:01 <vmassol> forcing users to have PR just because someone hardocded distinct is just bad  
12:01 <vmassol> ok cool ::)  
12:01 <jvelo> a generic API for script users  
12:01 <jvelo> but in this case yes you need another API w/o the 2 filters  
12:02 <jvelo> because it's just too much to explain  
12:02 <jvelo> it's like "ok so you can query documents, with the query service ; you write your query, oh and yes you need the hidden filter because bla-bla, and oh one more thing you need the distinct filter because bla bla"  
12:03 <vmassol> that's normal  
12:03 <vmassol> there isn't a single use case  
12:03 <jvelo> no that's not normal in my opinion  
12:03 <jvelo> because that's the standard use case  
12:03 <vmassol> there's nothing standard  
12:03 <vmassol> you're forgetting that we're not coding a wiki  
12:03 <jvelo> well I believed I wrote my own share of XWiki apps  
12:04 <vmassol> we're developing a generic development platform that can be used for a lot of different use cases  
12:04 <vmassol> again nothing prevents anyone from having higher level wrappers  
12:04 <vmassol> that put the behavior they want  
12:04 <jvelo> vmassol, yes but right now we are talking about the query SCRIPT SERVICe  
12:04 <jvelo> not the generic query module  
12:05 <vmassol> I'm talking about query manager in general  
12:05 <vmassol> for the script service we've been discussing with jv about putting "hidden" by default or not and I was against it because it breaks behaviors. But nothing prevents us from having a specialized version  
12:06 <jvelo> acutally no, we're talking about "short form" queries  
12:07 <jvelo> we should put the hidden filter by default in the script service  
12:07 <jvelo> and the distinct  
12:07 <vmassol> that's breaking everyone  
12:07 <jvelo> you put a flag in config  
12:07 <jvelo> and be done with it  
12:07 <vmassol> I love your way of designing  
12:07 <vmassol> by piling crap on top of crap :)  
12:08 <jvelo> because 1) not many people use XWQL to begin with because it's broken  
12:08 <jvelo> and because 2) you will deliver broken scripting APIs  
12:08 <vmassol> anyway this is ope for debate  
12:08 <vmassol> open  
12:08 <jvelo> (if you don't do that)  
12:08 <vmassol> we haven't decided this yet  
12:08 <vmassol> "1) not many people use XWQL to begin with because it's broken"  
12:08 <vmassol> ah?  
12:08 <vmassol> we use it everywhere and more evey day  
12:08 <vmassol> and we even recommend to everyone to use it  
12:08 <jvelo> well in my opinion if you force people to add hidden and distinct filters in velocity YOU are delivering the crap  
12:09 <jvelo> see what I mean when I say crap is relative  
12:09 <jvelo> ;)  
12:09 <vmassol> no  
12:09 <vmassol> it's not crap  
12:09 <vmassol> it may be complex  
12:09 <vmassol> but not crap  
12:09 <jvelo> well a compatilbity flag is not crap either  
12:09 <jvelo> it's a bold move to decide we want better APIs  
12:09 <vmassol> having 100000 flags in your app isn't solving your simplicity issue  
12:10 <jvelo> for API consumers it is  
12:10 <vmassol> maybe but you're forgetting the rest  
12:10 <vmassol> rest = admins, developers, documenters  
12:11 <jvelo> well I don't like them as well  
12:11 <vmassol> exactly  
12:11 <jvelo> don't worry, I know about it  
12:11 <jvelo> but for me it's the least of two evils  
12:11 <vmassol> so my POV is that we should try hard not to add them without a good reason  
12:12 <jvelo> sure but we should not sacrify end users APIs  
12:12 <vmassol> if you add a temporary flag you need a strategy to remove it  
12:12 <jvelo> that's the worst thing to do if you want my opinion  
12:12 <vmassol> there's nothing end users, it's for devs  
12:12 <jvelo> well "advanced" users  
12:12 <vmassol> but yes the dev api has to be as nice as possible for all use cases  
12:12 <jvelo> I mean consumers of XWiki APIs  
12:12 <jvelo> not the xwiki devleopment team  
12:13 <jvelo> exactly  
12:13 <vmassol> btw  
12:13 <vmassol> we have experienced what happens when we follow blindly your proposal  
12:13 <vmassol> this is what sergiu had done  
12:13 <vmassol> and which we've just reverted  
12:14 <jvelo> yes I know  
12:14 <vmassol> it has plagued us for several months/year  
12:14 <jvelo> ?  
12:14 <jvelo> what?  
12:14 <vmassol> the hidden stuff which was hardcoded in queries  
12:14 <jvelo> that's something different  
12:14 <jvelo> I don't see your point  
12:15 <vmassol> lunch time!  
12:16 <vmassol> anyway I know we agree  
12:16 <vmassol> it's fun to battle verbally but in the end I'm sure we agree...  
12:16 <jvelo> yes probably  
12:17 <mflorea> has quit  
12:17 <jvelo> and BTW it's not even self-interested, I know most pitfalls of our APIs so I can sneak around them ; but I'm thinking about new-comers  
12:46 <vmassol> has quit  
12:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:22 <CIA-120> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* rc9d6b8c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c9d6b8c8d60bdf4ea4a458eb07d6035dfac15d9a / (6 files in 6 dirs): XWIKI-7710 : Mark technical documents as hidden in platform applications ...  
13:54 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r6e73dba https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6e73dbaa1e071fa18e41449cdbf8c2d6efb93ec4 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ExtensionManagerMacros.xml : [misc] Refactor extension action buttons to remove duplicated code. - http://git.io/DNNFsQ  
13:57 <blackbird\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <blackbird\_> am I right that extensions EQ applications? when I add an extension, will it then appear in the list of applications? if not: what is the difference?  
13:58 <vmassol> blackbird\_: hi  
13:59 <blackbird\_> plus: how do I remove the google analytics appliacation?  
13:59 <blackbird\_> hi vmassol  
13:59 <vmassol> extensions can be different things: set of XAR pages or JARs  
13:59 <vmassol> they appear in the Extension Manager UI  
14:00 <vmassol> we're moving toward having everything in XWiki Enterprise be an extension  
14:00 <vmassol> right now you can install a XAR with either the EM or the Import feature  
14:00 <vmassol> if you installed with the import you'll need to remove all pages manually  
14:01 <vmassol> if you installed with EM then you can uninstall with a click  
14:01 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Manager+Application  
14:04 <blackbird\_> vmassol: great, thanks. but what are applications then? are applications a certain kind of extensions?  
14:04 <vmassol> what we used to call appliation is a set of pages, i.e. a XAR bundle  
14:04 <vmassol> and yes it's a kind of extension  
14:04 <blackbird\_> I see  
14:05 <vmassol> well we still call them applications  
14:05 <vmassol> it's just we don't care anymore of the format, we just have extensions that can be installed by the EM  
14:09 <abusenius\_> has quit  
14:16 <+sburjan`> vmassol: I re-tested just to make sure. Poostgres is broken on 3.5 snapshot  
14:17 <+sburjan`> I am going to test migration on latest 4.0 snapshot to see if we can release 4.0. I am almost sure Postgres is broken on 4.0 too  
14:24 <blackbird\_> what can I do if I created a regular space (with dashboard) and then created an app (appw/inminutes) with the same name. now I don't see the regular app mask (with "create new item" etc.) but only the regular dashboard.  
14:25 <Denis> has quit  
14:39 <polx> has quit  
14:41 <+sburjan`> MySQL migrations fail on 4.0. I will create a blocker with the stacktrace  
14:46 <blackbird\_> how do I create subpages?  
14:47 <blackbird\_> blackbird\_: answer to q1: delete space page and recreate app  
14:50 <blackbird\_> blackbird\_: answer to q2: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/HowDoYouCreateSubpages  
14:51 <blackbird\_> can one create subspaces?  
14:56 <jvelo> blackbird\_, that does not exists really at the moment  
14:59 <+sburjan`> Enygma`: did you tested your Migration Manager for annotations ? I get a odd issue, when a reply to a comment on 2.7.2 becomes reply to an annotation after migrating to 4.0  
15:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:13 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <+sburjan`> Oracle migration fails too.  
15:16 <blackbird\_> jvelo: what a pitty... :/  
15:16 <blackbird\_> where can I view my wanted pages?  
15:18 <cjd> has quit  
15:19 <vmassol> sburjan`: where is this breakage reported in jira?  
15:19 <vmassol> (for 3.5.1)  
15:20 <vmassol> can you create those issues and make sure sdumitriu knows about them so that he can work on them asap  
15:20 <vmassol> ?  
15:21 <vmassol> an also report the annotation migrator issue as a blocker too for 4.0  
15:21 <vmassol> s/an/and/  
15:22 <vmassol> lots of issues....  
15:22 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <blackbird\_> repeat: where can I view my wanted pages?  
15:26 <+Enygma`> sburjan`: I`d like more details on the problems you`re facing  
15:27 <+sburjan`> vmassol: Denis already reported the failure on Postgres. Migration with ID 4000. But in order to have consistency, I have created a blocker for MySQL and a blocker for Oracle. There might be only one problem that fails over all of them  
15:27 <+sburjan`> Enygma`: I am investigating now on hsqldb, since other db's fail on migration :|  
15:27 <vmassol> sburjan`: ok  
15:29 <faryshta> has quit  
15:30 <blackbird\_> quick question: when I have an app, do I always have to create a new page for each new entry?  
15:33 <blackbird\_> I would prefer to only insert some entries so I have a table (sheet) of values, but not hundrets of pages  
15:33 <vmassol> "when I have an app, do I always have to create a new page for each new entry?" what does this mean?  
15:35 <+Enygma`> blackbird\_: you can structure you app to produce objects inside a page, not necessarily pages inside a space... if that is what you`re asking  
15:36 <blackbird\_> when I have an app (created with appwithinaminute) and I want to create a new entry (I like to compare an entry with a row in a relationale database) I always have to create a new xwiki page before I can enter the data  
15:36 <blackbird\_> let's imagine I want to create a time tracking app. when someone simply wants to enter his name, the according project and the time, it's unnecessary to always create a page, when just adding some values would be enough!  
15:37 <blackbird\_> Enygma`: no sorry, I think I misexplained myself. refer to my last 2 lines.  
15:41 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <blackbird\_> Enygma`: but when I look at this screenshot [http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application/AppWithinMinutes-HomePage.png] it doesn't seem to me that there always is a single page necessary? did I config my app improperly?  
15:43 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
15:48 <+Enygma`> blackbird\_: (I`m not an authority on AppWithinMinutes) The big advantage in structuring your application entries into individual pages is that you have the benefits of XWikiPages: versioning, comments, translations, etc.  
15:48 <+Enygma`> When creating custom applications (outside of AppWithinMinutes) you can choose a diferent path (objects into pages) but you have to take care of implementing all the other things that XWiki pages offer by default
